wikipedia_page.main: Sir Charles James Jackson (2 May 1849 – 23 April 1923) was a British businessman, collector, barrister, newspaper executive, politician, and writer, who was an authority on antique gold and silver plate.

response: * Charles James Jackson (1849–1923), British newspaper publisher, specialist on silver and gold
* № 6 William Brett, 1st Viscount Esher, judge (1870–99); Charles James Jackson businessman and collector.Welsh Biography Online http://wbo.llgc.org.uk/en/s8-JACK-JAM-1849.html

In 1877 Lord Bute sold the Western Mail to Carr and Daniel Owen. By 1881, Carr had remarried, to Helen sister of Sir Charles James Jackson, and the 1881 Census records that they had three daughters. In 1884, Carr and Owen formed the Daniel Owen and Co. Ltd as a joint stock company.
*Charles James Jackson  Well-known antiquarian, Barrister-at-law, author of leading text-books on gold and silver. Has rendered valuable assistance to the Red Cross.
